intro: Chassalia clusiifolia, commonly known as the golden star or false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble stars. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
